Class Playlist

java.lang.Object
Playlist
public class Playlist extends Object
The Playlist class constructs a playlist using an ArrayList containing the songs and their various attributes, such as time, artist, etc. It can construct using a default constructor leaving the ArrayList empty or it can call a readFile method and create a Playlist with the songs from the file The Playlist class also allows you to get songs from the playlist, get the amount of songs in a playlist, add songs and remove songs, as well as finding songs by their artists
Version:
1
Author:
Diego Cifuentes

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    Playlist()
    Default constructor for the Playlist, initializes a Playlist with an empty ArrayList Song
    Playlist​(String fileName)
    Constructor for a Playlist, calls the readFile method in order to parse the text file of info Strings, initialize the ArrayList with what is read in from the file

  • Constructor Details

    • Playlist

      public Playlist()
      Default constructor for the Playlist, initializes a Playlist with an empty ArrayList Song

    • Playlist

      public Playlist​(String fileName) throws IOException
      Constructor for a Playlist, calls the readFile method in order to parse the text file of info Strings, initialize the ArrayList with what is read in from the file
      Parameters:
      fileName - File containing the songs, artists, and time
      Throws:
      IOException - when an error occurs when trying to read from an input stream

  • Method Details

    • readFile

      public void readFile​(String fileName) throws IOException
      Reads in the given file, can be called upon when constructing a playlist or writing a new file
      Parameters:
      fileName - Is the file containing the songs, artists, and time
      Throws:
      IOException - when an error occurs when trying to read from an input stream

    • getNumSongs

      public int getNumSongs()
      Gets the number of songs in the playlist
      Returns:
      The size of the ArrayList

    • getSong

      public Song getSong​(int index)
      Returns the Song at the given index with the given index
      Parameters:
      index - Is the index containing the song to be searched for
      Returns:
      The song at a given index

    • getSongs

      public Song[] getSongs()
      Returns a new song array containing the songs from the playlist
      Returns:
      A new song array

    • addSong

      public boolean addSong​(Song song)
      Adds a given song the playlist
      Parameters:
      song - The song that is to be added to the playlist
      Returns:
      The playlist with the new song added

    • addSong

      public boolean addSong​(int index, Song song)
      If the Song reference is null or the index is out of bounds then the Playlist is left unchanged Otherwise it adds a Song to the playlist to a given index
      Parameters:
      index - The index where the song will be added
      song - The song to be added to the playlist
      Returns:
      True if the song is added, if the song reference is null or the index is out of bounds returns false

    • addSongs

      public int addSongs​(Playlist playlist)
      Adds a given song to the end of a playlist
      Parameters:
      playlist - Where the given song will be added to
      Returns:
      The number of added songs, if the playlist reference is null returns 0

    • addSongs

      public int addSongs​(String filename) throws IOException
      Reads in a file of info Strings. For each line of the file read, creates a Song and then adds it to the end of the Playlist ArrayList
      Parameters:
      filename - The info String containing the songs and its values such as time
      Returns:
      0
      Throws:
      IOException - when an error occurs when trying to read from an input stream

    • removeSong

      public Song removeSong()
      Removes a song from the playlist
      Returns:
      Playlist using the removeSong method with one less song in the ArrayList

    • removeSong

      public Song removeSong​(int index)
      Removes a song at the given index and returns the Song with that given index If index is out of bounds then returns null
      Parameters:
      index - The index containing the song to be removed
      Returns:
      The given song with its given index, if the index is out of bounds returns null

    • saveSongs

      public void saveSongs​(String filename) throws IOException
      Saves the output of the toString method to a file with a given name If a file exists it overwrites that file, if not a new file is created
      Parameters:
      filename - The file contains the info used to create a playlist
      Throws:
      IOException - when an error occurs when trying to read from an input stream

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Overrides the toString method in order to correctly print the output Returns the String representation of the Songs that are joined with line separators.
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object

    • findSongsByArtist

      public Song[] findSongsByArtist​(String artist)
      Returns a Song array containing all of the songs from the playlist with the artist passed in the parameters
      Parameters:
      artist - Is the artist that we are looking for
      Returns:
      An array of Songs containing songs by a given artist
